# Copilot Instructions for openbadge

## Project Overview

openbadge is an open-source project. This repository is currently in early development.

## Tech Stack

This project is currently minimal and may evolve to include:
- Standard open-source licensing (LICENSE file included)
- Documentation (README.md)

## Directory Structure

```
.
├── .github/           # GitHub configuration files
├── LICENSE            # Project license
└── README.md          # Project documentation
```

## Coding Guidelines

### General Practices
- Follow industry best practices for the technologies used
- Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code
- Use meaningful variable and function names
- Add comments for complex logic

### Code Style
- Follow the language-specific style guide for any code added to the project
- Use consistent formatting throughout the codebase
- Prefer readability over clever code

### Testing
- Include tests for new features and bug fixes
- Ensure existing tests pass before submitting changes
- Follow testing patterns established in the project

### Documentation
- Update README.md for significant features or changes
- Document new dependencies or setup requirements
- Keep inline code documentation up to date

### Dependencies
- Only add dependencies when necessary
- Prefer well-maintained, popular libraries
- Document the purpose of new dependencies

## Key Resources

- [README.md](../README.md) - Main project documentation
- [LICENSE](../LICENSE) - Project license information

## Good Tasks for Copilot

Copilot works best on:
- Adding new features with clear requirements
- Writing or updating tests
- Documentation improvements
- Bug fixes with clear reproduction steps
- Code refactoring with specific goals
- Adding examples or sample code

## How to Work with Copilot

1. Provide clear, specific issue descriptions
2. Include acceptance criteria in task descriptions
3. Specify which files or areas should be modified
4. Review all suggestions before accepting them
5. Iterate on feedback to refine solutions
